result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Edward Romano Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $650.00 payable to victim, Louise Allen; Cash bail applied.

Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA and any victim surcharges by the end of supervision. Payment terms and conditions to be determined by the agent. Pay all applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan. If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED:
- No Contact with the victim or her residence.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING (26 pages) commencing JULY 30, 2015 received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS/MONTHS with 79 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 years probation.


Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- No contact with the victim or the residence.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Payment terms and condtitions to be determined by the agent. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $650.00 payable to Louise Allen; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.


Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
At the Courts request, and without objection from the State or defense counsel, plea and sentencing hearing is moved from 07/31/2015 at 8:30am to 07/30/2015 at 8:30am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court via telephone, defendant Anthony Edward Romano not in court, in custody.  Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense attorney has an emergency and cannot proceed.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Anthony Edward Romano not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Defense no longer wishes to have a bail review.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter for Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LOUISE A.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Anthony Edward Romano in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
